page.title: 04Oundle School
page.content: On Thursday the 16th May 1985 Penny Keeling and I went on a tour of Oundle School. There have been two organs in the school counting the new one. That organ is called the Frobenius and is named after its builder and designer. At the back of the chapel are some windows called the Seven Ages of Man designed by John Piper. The first window represents the infant, the second represents a schoolboy creeping unwillingly to school, the third window represents the lover, the fourth window represents the soldier, the fifth window represents the Justice of the Peace, the sixth window represents the headmaster, the last one represents the second child. At the cloisters there is the oldest staircase in the school which is made of marble and is very beautiful.
